11111.content:
"...And the land was owned by some Margaret Werchinsky up until her passing a short while ago, where she left it to you. Not sure about the family connection but she was adamant about it going to you, gave a full description of how to find you."

The agent had been droning on for a while now on the walk up to the old mansion. You two had been forced to ditch the car just before the small river bridge - some five hundred meters from the mansion. This area was completely unfamiliar to you and you hadn't even heard of a 'Werchinsky' name before.

"Yeesh, how much is this going to cost me?" You asked him.
"Oh? Nothing. She stipulated that any costs in the transference of ownership would come out of her account. I know we said that you had just thirty acres of land just attached to the mansion, but it's actually more like about a hundred. The remaining seventy is tied up in trusts. But as the head of the trust, Miss Werchinsky made a truckload off renting the land to farmers. So if anything, you'll be making a fortune just by sitting around doing nothing. Occasionally, you'll need to hire in some people to maintain the land. But that's easy enough"

Making a profit from sitting on your butt? That was like a dream come true. Especially considering what it costs for a few square meters in a New York apartment. You'd come all the way from your town half days trip from here but it seems like your needful requirement to find a job would soon be over.

"Oh, and there was one other thing. Miss Werchinsky was adamant that you wear this for the first week" The agent said, handing you a plain silver ring.
"Whats this thing?" You asked.

"Miss Werchinsky was very firm in her belief in ghosts. Which the rest of the town found a bit odd. Still, she never bothered anyone about it so we never asked"
"Do I have to wear it?" You asked, raising an eyebrow.
"Requirements for inheritance. One week only, after that I couldn't care less if you binned it"

You put the ring on and finally made it to the front door.
"Well, here we are. I'll let you get yourself acquainted. I'll be down at the car if you need me in the next hour"
"Thanks..." You said uncomfortably. Something about this house was... odd. It seemed quite dark inside, dingy.

Before you could say anything else, the agent had scurried away, so you pushed the big wooden front doors open and walked inside.
For lack of a better word, the room you stepped into seemed more like a fully fledged ballroom, with wide flight of stairs at the rear leading up to an overhanging balcony. There was another set of large doors at the back under the balcony and a few smaller doors flanking the room - possibly to let servants in and out?

You moved slowly into the ballroom, leaving the door behind you wide open. Moving from room to room, you got a better sense of the scale of the house. It appeared to have no less than fifty bedrooms, a large study and a kitchen that you'd never be able to use to it's full potential. The dining room appeared to be able to seat around forty people - maybe guests for the ballroom from a long time ago? The master bedroom was quite grand... and cleaner than any other room in the house. That being said, the entire house was furnished immaculately, and there was little to no sign of dust around. Either it was magic, or someone was maintaining this place.

You completed your tour and ended up in the ballroom again.

15312121212.content:
When Mark woke up in the morning, he found the spot on the bed next to him empty.

‘Jessica?’ He yawned. He slipped his feet over the side of the bed into his pair of slippers, noticing that Jessica’s were still in their spot on her side of the bed. He frowned slightly. She always wore her slippers of a morning, she hated cold floors and this mansion was full of them.

He shrugged and pulled on his dressing gown. ‘Maybe she’d just put them back after she put her shoes on, or something,’ he thought to himself.

The mansion was not a welcoming place. He trudged through the hallways, half remembering the location. He’d only been to the place once or twice as a child, but it was just as intimidating now as it had been then. Hallways that seemed to go on forever. So very many rooms that he had been forbidden to enter. And always, always, that feelings of coldness, of being watched, of something within the stone, following you throughout the house. Observing. Making notes. No, preying. Why had that particular word come to the forefront of his mind?

More pressing was the issue of why his aunt had left the mansion to him. As far as he was aware, his aunt and mother had been close at children, true, but had drifted apart over the years. He’d always put it down to his aunt inheriting this huge house instead of his mother way back when, but his mother had always insisted that this wasn’t the case. He just insisted that her sister had changed after she got her own place, suddenly didn’t have all that much time for her, and they’d drifted apart naturally after that. Sure, they still met at the holidays and such, but it was always a strained meeting and his mother always got the feeling that his aunt just wanted everyone else gone so that she could get on with her work.

No one knew what his aunt did for work. She was always flush with cash, but whenever he asked his mother, or his other aunts and uncles, he’d always get a different answer. He somewhat suspected it was something not altogether seemly, from how they answered, but he was suspected that they just plain didn’t know.

Lost in his thoughts as he was, he found himself wandering through the left wing of the mansion, which was an area he had been especially forbidden from entering on his previous visits. Even now, as an adult, an adult who actually owned the premises, he felt the instinct to turn about and leave immediately when he suddenly heard someone singing in one of the rooms down the corridor. It was a woman singing, no, not singing, chanting really. She had an odd lilt to her voice, a sort of mixture between Irish and Welsh, which reminded him vaguely of someone but he couldn’t quite remember who.

As quietly as he could, he crept down the hallway. Inexplicably, as he went, the light disappeared. It got darker and darker as he approached the doorway from which the chanting was coming, but he kept his nerve and kept on going, until the corridor was pitch black, save for the doorway he had been creeping towards, the outline of which shone like a flickering gold fire in the shadows. He reached the door and, taking a deep breath, prodded it open and peeked inside.

There was Jessica. She was dressed in a low-cut black dress, her breasts all but hanging out of it, with her hands raised to the sky. Beneath her, a shimmering red series of symbols cast dark shadows behind her which jumped and danced about not at all in step with her movement. She was looking straight up but then there was a snap and a howling gust of wind and the room was suddenly full of daylight. The symbols and the red light were gone and Jessica lowered her arms, looked straight at Mark, and tutted. Mark stood there with his jaw agape. Jessica tutted again, then moved to the back of the room and went behind an ornate screen that Mark was only just now seeing. Mark heard something click and then watched as Jessica sauntered back around the screen, one arm holding the crook of the other which had a lit cigarillo in it. She raised it to her mouth, deep inhale, then exhale, and it was this that broke Mark. Jessica would never.

‘You…Jessica….you’re not….’

Jessica then smiled coquettishly.

‘Mmm, I am, I was, but then again, I most assuredly now am not, am I’ She took another deep drag on her cigarillo. ‘You know who I am now though, don’t you?’

A name ran through Mark’s head, but he couldn’t quite catch it to match it with the reality before him. He knew that pose, he knew that dress, he knew her name….it just…wasn’t possible though, was it?

His mouth was suddenly very dry. He licked his lips but that only highlighted the sudden dryness. Finally, he managed to croak:
‘You…you’re….’

info.brief_description: You inherit of a mansion in a big plot of land...
info.description:
You inherit from a unknown parent a mansion in a big plot of land. But you soon discover some unexpected things.
It's up to you to decide what's going on with theses stranges things. Be creative, make the continuation better than the last.

It's a fantasy story, magic is here, like surnatural beeing and spells. That can be on sexual themes or not. You can do TG, TF, bimbofication, mind bending, ...

You can talk at the third person or the first, but if a story begin in the third continue in that way, same thing with the first person.

You can follow multiple character or change the main character. Except for stories at the first person, these one please keep the first person for the main character for more clarity.

You can close a story, but please do it well, don't stop in a middle of something with a cheap solution.

You can kill characters too, but there too do it well, don't kill someone with few words and make him disapear of the story like he has never existed. The dead of the main character don't mean inevitably the end of the story, another character can continue the story.

I think I have say all I want you to know. :)
